Row.Text: Recently, a group of {1_Language}-speaking Belgians have caused a stir by demanding equal representation of their language in the courts. They see the lack of use for their language to convey Belgian laws as an affront to their protection beneath those laws. We must act to resolve this issue before it gets out of hand.[NEWLINE]
Very well. There shall be equal use of the languages within the courts.
Absolutely not. Dutch is the language of our laws and so it shall stay.
We have resolved linguistic tensions within our nation by establishing equal representation of our languages within the courts.
We have dismissed the tensions caused by linguistic divisions in the country.
{1_Language}-speaking Belgians have caused tensions in Belgium.
It has been a profitable year for our plantation industry, and we have reaped a hefty surplus. Things are doing well in our colonies.[NEWLINE]
It has been a profitable year for our plantation industry.
Belgium has had a profitable year for their plantation industry.
